body.p: To the Excelency of the govenor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Plesant Meadors and Thomas R Harmon wold Respectfully Represent to your excelence that at the March turme of the Whitley Circuit Courte that they was two Judgements Rendered a gaming to one Thomas E Meadors for twenty dollars each for Retailing liquor in Quantites less then a half Gallon they state that Meadows ^as I am enformed and believes^ had the spirits when the Rebles was in heare and was hiding it and he was poor suaded that if they was ^no^ law and him being ignarnt of the facts then sold the liquare with out any intention of violating the law and was endited and find as a fore said and to Provent his being Put in Jail your Petitioners Replevid the Judgements and that Thomas E Meadors is a pore man and has a famley and is unable to pay the fine and do Justice to his famley and that he is lawel to the govment and unless your excelence enterposes that your Petitioner will inter have to Pay the Judgements and that they are lawel and that your Petitioner T. R. Harmon seved a tower in the 14 Regim & Ky Vol untell discharge for want of disabilaty and that we onley Replevid the debts to Plesant Meadors from being Placed in Jail and if they have to Pay the Judgement that they now will have it to luse that they cant calect it of Meado
Wheare for they Pray your excelence to Remit the fine and Releas your Petitioner from the Replevin Bond and for all Proper Release

P LW Meadors
T R Harmon
P Meadors says he beleaves the statements to be true
Sworn to before me by P W Meadors this 19th day of June 1864
C. L. Creekmore P J W C
We the undersigned ask that the fine be Remited

John Smith
C. Creekmore P. J. W. C C
J C Watkins clk
S Deham
F. L. Gatliff
L P Bird
